intro: Hieracium camkorijense subsp. camkorijense, commonly known as the Camkorijean hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
